resources.string: Start scan and deletion for all tools with a tap on the dashboard\'s action button, no extra confirmations.
The generated file contains sensitive information (e.g. file names and installed apps). Only share it with trusted parties.

This feature records everything the app is doing into a shareable file. The generated file contains sensitive information (e.g. file names and installed apps). Only share it with trusted parties (e.g. a developer that is troubleshooting an issue).
SD Maid SE manages files, apps and storage.
Gain storage space by cleaning up behind other apps. Delete expendable files and remove leftover data.
This is a beta (testing) build. Proceed with a sense of humor and a backup plan. Please report issues you encounter.
SD Maid SE (aka. SD Maid 2) is the successor to SD Maid (aka. SD Maid 1). A new app, optimized for modern Android.
It\'s predecessor\'s architecture is over 7 years old and not designed for the challenges of newer Android versions. A complete redesign was necessary to continue development.
Consider switching to SD Maid SE for improved results.
SD Maid 1\'s \"pro status\" is unfortunately not transferable to SD Maid 2/SE. After 12 years of free updates, a new purchase is required to sustain development (feed the developer).
SD Maid has no ads and does not sell user data.
Bug reports are sent when errors occur and may contain details about apps and files on your device. Reports help me fix bugs and improve the app.
These options can be changed in the settings.
SD Maid will search all accessible data areas.
What is accessible depends on your device, Android version and granted permissions.
Start using SD Maid by setting up access to areas that should be searched.
Become a patron and make continued development possible.
General tweaks that affect the whole app.
The mode used when theming the app (e.g. night or day).
The color style used when theming the app.
Display file previews in all tools (e.g. image and video thumbnails).
Read documentation, report issues, chat with others or record debug logs.
A public issue tracker for bug reports and feature requests.
Automatic error reports are anonymous. Share your install ID if the developer needs to find your error reports.
Record everything the app is doing into a text file that you can share.
A place to hang out in and ask questions.
Finish SD Maid\'s setup to get better results.
SD Maid is trying to fix setup issues.
Show setup screen again, including already completed items.
Improve results by granting SD Maid access to additional areas.
In most cases the window will open with the correct path preselected. Entries turn green when access is granted.
The Documents UI app is unavailable. It\'s a built-in system app and should be available on all Android devices.
Allow SD Maid to manage your storage.
Basic access to public storage, e.g. "Download/" and "DCIM/", but not always "Android/data".
Should SD Maid use root access if it is available? Root access can be used to check additional system folders and private application data.
Only available on rooted devices. If you didn\'t make this modification, then your device is not rooted and this setting has no effect.
Allow SD Maid to use Shizuku where possible to improve results and enable features.
This setting has no effect if the Shizuku app is not set up on your device.
You can find the setup screen again via the settings menu.
The usage statistics permission grants access to more app details. SD Maid uses it to determine additional cache sizes.
Required for accessibility service based cache deletion.
Allow SD Maid to post notifications to inform you about on-going operations or important events.
This feature requires completion additional setup items: %s
The accessibility service allows SD Maid to interact with your screen and automate tedious actions, e.g. tapping \"Clear cache\" on multiple screens.
SD Maid will not use the accessibility service without your consent, will always display a prominent (cancelable) indicator while active and will not use it to collect information.
Service will be launched on demand
The service is enabled, but not running. Toggle it off/on or reboot your device. Check that SD Maid is not being "optimized" by the system.
If the service keeps getting disabled after a while, try enabling the "Auto Start" option for SD Maid in the system settings.
If you see a little icon on the screen edge, then you accidentally enabled the "shortcut" option.
If you change your mind, you can alter this option again by going into settings and restarting the setup.

Can\'t enable SD Maids accessibility service? Android 13+ may apply restrictions to apps not installed via Google Play. Lift these restrictions from the system\'s detail page for SD Maid. The option is in the context menu in the top right corner.
SD Maid didn\'t find any data areas that can be scanned. Did you complete the setup?
Enable test options and more verbose output. App will run slower and perform differently.
Automatically reports issues, e.g. details on the app crashes so I can figure out why and fix it.
Data belonging to already removed apps.
Adjust scan filters and risk levels.
Files that you might want to keep, even if the app is uninstalled, e.g. photos you took or backups you created.
Data with too common names, e.g. a folder \"Notes\" is owned by too many unknown apps.
Automatically scan for remnants when an app removed.
Automatically delete any remnants related to the uninstalled app.

plurals.name: corpsefinder_watcher_notification_delete_result
plurals.item: Clean up successful (%1$s): Freed %2$s and removed %3$d item.
Clean up successful (%1$s): Freed %2$s and removed %3$d items.

resources.string: Public media files, e.g. files received via messenger apps.
Additional app resources, e.g. game assets.
Non-sensitive app data, e.g. map caches.
General public storage, internal and external (e.g. SD cards).
Private app data, e.g. credentials, app settings but also browser caches.
App installation data, i.e. where APKs go.
Restricted app installation data, e.g. protected third party apps.
Encrypted app resources, e.g. game assets.
Data moved to external storage by App2Sd mods.
This item may contain data you want to keep despite it\'s owner being uninstalled, e.g. photos or backups.
This item has a very common name and could belong to still installed apps that SD Maid doesn\'t know.
Superfluous data that doesn\'t belong to any specific app.
Create, delete, import and export your custom filters.
Log files (*.log) from all over the device.
Files that have been created for or by advertisements.
Empty directories from all over the device. Nested directories may require multiple passes.
Setup files that are older or equal to app versions that are already installed.
Temporary files that are created when transferring data between Android devices.
Files and folders that are created when storage has been connected to a linux computer.
Files and folders that are created when browsing storage with Apple\'s finder app.
"Data that the Windows file explorer can create on connected storage. "
Cached previews for images and videos.
Temporary files, usually short lived caches for active operations.
Data related to analytics and bug tracking.
System cache folder used for various things (e.g. OTA updates).
System related temporary files (e.g. from Android Studio).
An area for the system to drop log files into.
Data related to the tasks history in the system\'s task switcher.
If native processes crash (e.g. games), then files are created here.
Files related to application usage stats.
Create a custom filter to delete extra files that are unique to your device and use-cases.
Custom filters can be risky. Check your scan results before deleting!
If no area is selected, then all accessible data areas will be scanned and matched.
If no type is selected, then all types will be matched.
The target path needs to match at least one entry (e.g. \"Downloads/oldapks/game-\"). Long press entries for more options.
The target name must contain at least one of the keywords (e.g. \"-receipt\"). Long press entries for more options.
The result will be excluded if the path matches any entry (e.g. \"DCIM\"). Long press entries for more options.
Expendable data belonging to specific apps.
Default public app caches. Accessible under Android/data on older Android versions. Deleted when tapping "Clear cache" in the system settings.
Default private app caches. Deleted when tapping "Clear cache" in the system settings.
Include system apps in the scan.
Include apps that are currently running which may cause interference.
Include data that can\'t be accessed directly but can be deleted via system settings and automated using an accessibility service.
Include apps from other user profiles on this device.
Skip apps where the sum of expendable data is below the minimum.
Skip files that are younger than the minimum age.
Accessibility based automation may fail if SD Maid doesn\'t detect your OS correctly. Use this setting to override the detected type.
JVM code cache. Blocks of bytecode compiled into native code.
Files related to advertisements, e.g. cached media.
Bug reporting related data, e.g. error logs or crash dumps.
Analytics related data, e.g. cached stats for what you tap in an app.
General purpose caches stored outside of the system\'s reach.
Image, video and audio preview thumbnail pictures.
Game related resources that the game would reload on next launch if necessary.
Files stored for use when offline, e.g. map tiles.
Files that have been deleted but put into a special folder to allow to restore them.
Files cached by Webview instances used within apps.
Delete extra copies of WhatsApp backups and only keep the latest.
Files you received from people via WhatsApp.
Files sent from WhatsApp to others.
Files received or send through Telegram.
Sent or received files in conversations and WeChat moments.
Cached media files that are downloaded again when viewed in chat.
Delete expendable items for all apps?
Public and private default caches. Not directly accessible, but can be deleted indirectly (e.g. via accessibility service).
Clearing inaccessible caches requires SD Maid\'s accessibility service, but it was unavailable. If you don\'t want to use it: Disable the option "Include inaccessible caches".

plurals.name: appcleaner_delete_confirmation_message_selected_x_items
plurals.item: Delete expendable files for %d selected app?
Delete expendable files for %d selected apps?

resources.string: Enabling an app allows it to run and may make it visible in your launcher if it has an activity.
Disabling an app prevents it from running and hides it from menus. There is no data loss.
Open this app in the app store it was installed from.
Open your device\'s system settings for this app.
Uninstall this app from your device.
Exclude this app from other operations in SD Maid.
This app is currently excluded from one or more tools.
Find out what is taking up space on your device.
The primary storage of your device. Contains the internal SD card, private storage for apps and system data.
A secondary storage, usually a removable SD card. Contains media files and data from apps that support it.
Space occupied by installed apps and their data (i.e. application files, data and caches).
Captured pictures, recorded videos or downloaded data. Any data that doesn\'t belong to a specific app.
System apps and system data. Apps and data from other users, if several user accounts are set on this device.
Application files, libraries and resources. This space can only be freed by uninstalling the app.
Media files from this app, e.g. received WhatsApp photos.
Extra data that this app has placed outside of the default paths, e.g. photos or downloads.
Data areas represent locations on your device that are accessible to SD Maid. Different data areas may be available depending on your Android version and the permissions that have been granted.
Areas that SD Maid can access based on the currently granted permissions.
Exclude files and apps from SD Maid\'s operations.
Add new exclusions by first letting SD Maid search and then using the context menu on the result you want to exclude.
A path exclusion prevents SD Maid from further processing any matching paths. This applies to files, directories and sub-directories.
An app exclusion prevents SD Maid from processing any matching packages.
A segment based exclusion is similar to a path exclusion but allows for partial matches. Example: \"DCIM/Camera\" excludes \"/sdcard/DCIM/Camera/photo.png\".
Use the AppControl tool to create app exclusions.
Use the StorageAnalyzer tool to create path exclusions.

Users with special accessibility needs can enable this service to allow SD Maid to automate tasks that would otherwise require tedious manual user interaction (e.g. cache deletion).

Example: If you instruct SD Maid to stop multiple apps then SD Maid can use this service to open each apps settings screen, find the 'Force Stop' button and tap it.

SD Maid will always prominently show when using this service and provide an easy way for the user to cancel any interaction immediately.

No actions will be performed without prior user approval. This service can be disabled again at any time without adverse effects.
SD Maid is interacting with your device. It\'s not possible to use the screen at the same time. Wait until the operation is finished or cancel it.
Accessibility service is not set up. Complete the setup and give consent.
Accessibility service is disabled. Turn it on again.
Accessibility service is not running. Try rebooting the device.
A chronological list of recent actions and affected data.
Expected execution times are approximations. Schedules may be delayed or expedited if it conserves battery.
If the device is in power-saving mode, the scheduled execution will be skipped.
If the device is not charging, the scheduled execution will be skipped.
Include actions that use an accessibility service. This requires that SD Maid can interact with your screen (i.e. it\'s unlocked) when the tasks are executed.
An update is available. You have %1$s and the latest version is %2$s.
SD Maid is translated by volunteers. Translation, review or proofreading, your help is appreciated!
Allow SD Maid to check for important messages from the developer.
